01.text: These verses explain Herod's reaction when he heard about Jesus. This event happens some time after the events that follow in the narrative. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_events]])
"In those days" or "While Jesus was ministering in Galilee"
"heard reports about Jesus" or "heard about the fame of Jesus"

01.ref: Therefore these powers are at work in him
01.text: Some Jews at that time believed if a person came back from the dead he would have powers to do mighty things.

03.text: Here the author begins to tell about how Herod had executed John the Baptist. These events occur some time before the event in the previous verses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_events]])
The writer recounts the story of John the Baptist's death in order to show why Herod reacted the way he did when he heard about Jesus.
If needed, you can reverse the order of events in 9:3-4 as in the UDB. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_events]])

03.ref: Herod had arrested John, bound him, and put him in prison
03.text: It says that Herod did these things because he ordered others to do them for him. AT: "Herod ordered his soldiers to arrest and bind John the Baptist and put him in prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Philip is the name of Herod's brother. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

03.ref: For John had said to him, "It is not lawful for you to have her as your wife."
03.text: This can be expressed as an indirect quote, if needed. AT: "For John had said to him that it was not lawful for him to have her as his wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

03.ref: For John had said to him
03.text: "For John had kept saying to Herod"
Philip was still alive when Herod married Herodias. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

06.text: You can make explicit the implicit information. AT: "in the midst of the guests attending the birthday celebration" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

08.ref: After being instructed by her mother
08.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "After her mother instructed her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the daughter of Herodias said to Herod"

08.ref: The king was very upset by her request
08.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Her request made the king very upset" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

08.ref: he ordered that it should be done
08.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he ordered his men to do what she said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

10.text: This concludes the account of how Herod executed John the Baptist.

10.ref: his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl
10.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Use the word for a young, unmarried girl.
The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "the disciples of John went and told Jesus what had happened to John the Baptist" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

13.text: These verses describe how Jesus reacted when he heard that Herod had executed John the Baptist.
These verses give background information about the miracle that Jesus is about to perform by feeding five thousand people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This word is used here to mark a break in the main storyline. Here Matthew starts to tell a new part of the story.
"heard what happened to John" or "heard the news about John"
"he left" or "he went away from the crowd." It is implied that Jesus' disciples went with him. AT: "Jesus and his disciples left" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

13.ref: When the crowds heard of it
13.text: "When the crowds heard where Jesus had gone" or "When the crowds heard that he had left"
"the crowds of people" or "the huge group of people" or "the people"
This means that the people in the crowd were walking. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

13.ref: Then Jesus came before them and saw the large crowd
13.text: "When Jesus came ashore, he saw a large crowd"

15.text: This begins the account of Jesus feeding five thousand people with only five small loaves of bread and two small fish.

16.text: "The people in the crowd have no need"
The word "You" is plural, referring to the disciples. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
A loaf of bread is a lump of dough that is shaped and baked.
"Bring the loaves and fish to me"

19.text: This concludes the account of Jesus feeding five thousand people.
"lie down." Use the verb for the position people in your culture usually are in when they eat.
"held in his hands." He did not steal them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Possible meanings are 1) "While looking up" or 2) "After looking up."
This can be translated in active form. AT: "until they were full" or "until they were no longer hungry" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the disciples gathered up" or "some people gathered up"
"Those who ate the bread and the fish" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

22.text: The following verses describe events that happened right after Jesus fed the five thousand people.
These verses give background information about the miracle that Jesus is about to perform of walking on water.
"Right after Jesus had fed all the people,"
"Late in the evening" or "When it became dark"

22.ref: being tossed about by the waves
22.text: "and the disciples could not control the boat because of the large waves"

22.ref: for the wind was blowing against them
22.text: "for their boat was sailing into the wind" or "for the wind was against them" and they could not make progress because of the wind.

25.text: The fourth watch is between 3 a.m. and sunrise. AT: "Just before dawn"
a spirit that has left the body of a person who has died

28.text: Here "saw the wind" means he became aware of the wind. AT: "when Peter saw that the wind was tossing the waves back and forth" or "when he realized how strong the wind was" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

31.text: "You who have such little faith." Jesus is scolding the people because they have little faith in God. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:mat:06:30|6:30]].

Jesus uses a question to tell Peter than he should not have doubted. You can make explicit what Peter should not have doubted. AT: "you should not have doubted that I could keep you from sinking" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is an important title for Jesus that describes his relationship to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])

34.text: These verses describe what happened after Jesus walked on the water. They summarize how the people were responding to Jesus' ministry.
"When Jesus and his disciples had crossed over the lake"
This is a small town on the northwest shore of the Sea of Galilee. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"the men of that area sent messages"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "became well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
